articles.author: David Shepardson, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: China's embassy in Washington on Tuesday defended its business practices after U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo said U.S. firms had told her that China had become "uninvestible."
articles.title: China, in response to US's Raimondo, says it is easing market access for foreign firms

articles.author: Clare Jim
articles.description: Just how cash-strapped embattled Country Garden Holdings (2007.HK) is will be the focus when China's largest private property developer is due to report its first-half results on Wednesday.
articles.title: All eyes on Country Garden's cash flow as troubled firm set to report loss

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: A U.S. judge has rejected Burger King's bid to dismiss a lawsuit claiming that it cheated hungry customers by making its Whopper sandwich appear larger than it actually is.
articles.title: Burger King must face lawsuit claiming its Whoppers are too small

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares in China's banking sector dropped on Wednesday on worries that a reduction in existing mortgage rates will dent the profitability of lenders already reeling from a worsening property sector crisis and slowing economy.
articles.title: Chinese bank shares fall on existing mortgages rate cut concerns

articles.author: Leika Kihara
articles.description: Bank of Japan board member Naoki Tamura said the central bank could have enough data in the first quarter of next year to judge whether inflation can sustainably hit its 2% target, a prerequisite for phasing out ultra-loose monetary policy.
articles.title: BOJ policymaker signals chance of policy tweak early next year

articles.author: Raphael Satter
articles.description: British officials are warning organisations about integrating artificial intelligence-driven chatbots into their businesses, saying that research has increasingly shown that they can be tricked into performing harmful tasks.
articles.title: British officials say AI chatbots could carry cyber risks

articles.author: Lewis Jackson
articles.description: Australia's sovereign wealth fund missed its return target for the year to June and its chairman warned on Wednesday that markets were downplaying the risks from China's economic slowdown and rising inflation.
articles.title: Australia's sovereign fund misses return target, says outlook choppy

articles.author: Allison Lampert, Gabriel Araujo, Valerie Insinna
articles.description: Russia has informed Brazil's aircraft investigation authority that it will not probe the crash of the Brazilian-made Embraer (EMBR3.SA) jet that killed mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin under international rules "at the moment", the Brazilian agency told Reuters on Tuesday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Russia will not probe Prigozhin plane crash under international rules

articles.author: Marco Bello, Joseph Ax
articles.description: Hurricane Idalia gained strength over the Gulf of Mexico on Tuesday on its relentless crawl toward Florida's Gulf Coast, forcing evacuations in low-lying coastal areas expected to be swamped when the powerful storm hits on Wednesday.
articles.title: Hurricane Idalia strengthens en route to Florida, threatening dangerous storm surge

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A group of senior Gabonese military officers appeared on television channel Gabon 24 in the early hours of Wednesday and said they had taken power, after the state election body announced President Ali Bongo had won a third term.
articles.title: Gabonese military officers announce on television they have seized power
